story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAnd next week the Councilrsquos Cabinet will also consider whether to introduce a Public Space Protection Order in the area, meaning drinking alcohol there would be strictly controlled.If the order is implemented, Police and Council Enforcement Officers would have the power to confiscate alcohol and issue Fixed Penalty Notices to those who ignore restrictions.With some businesses now allowed to sell alcohol on a take away basis or for consumption in their own outdoor areas, there are suggestions this is causing problems in some cases.The Council has received reports of groups congregating outside certain premises, that proper social distancing is not always being observed and incidents of anti-social behaviour are taking place.Council Leader Neil Moore and Managing Director Rob Thomas have sent a letter to pubs, cafes and restaurants, asking forassistance in addressing recent problems, with retailers urged to be careful when selling alcohol.Businesses have also been reminded thatirresponsible alcohol sales are identied as contributing to unacceptable behaviour, they could face enforcement action.Cllr Neil Moore said: ldquoI am aware of issues linked to excessive alcohol consumption affecting Penarth Esplanade and have written to local licensees asking for their help to address them.ldquoI appreciate this has been a dficult time for the hospitality industry and I welcome the fact many businesses have begun trading again, but the sale of alcohol must be carried out responsibly.ldquoScenes of large gatherings, sometimes without proper social distancing, and incidents of anti-social behaviour are not acceptable and will not be tolerated. They threaten to damage the reputation of the Penarth Esplanade area and make it less appealing to visitors. With that in mind, it is in everyonersquos interests that the Esplanade remains a safe, family friendly place for everyone to enjoy.ldquoI will soon discuss with my Cabinet colleagues the possibility of introducing a Public Space Protection Order at the Esplanade making it illegal to consume alcohol in public areas.ldquoIn the meantime, Council officers will be carrying out regular checks around this location to make sure alcohol sales comply with the terms of inidual licences and are not contributing to poor behaviour. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a commentOrder byOldest firstNewest firstHighest scoredLowest scoredLoading comments... title: penarth businesses residents speak council plans
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityPenarth Town Council hasstressed the ideas are "points for discussion" before a formal proposal is put to the Vale Council. They also said a trial period will not take place in August and September.Ideas, revealed by the town council in an online questionnaire on Friday, includes a pedestrianised ldquosafe space on Windsor Road from Arcot Street to the roundabout, including the bottom of Lower Glebe Street.Other plans for Windsor Road could include ldquoshared spaces between pedestrians and traffic during set times, while another included only allowing service traffic ndash such as delivery vehicles ndash to access Windsor Road and Lower Glebe Street.One of the major points for discussion is around proposals for a one-way traffic system incorporating Albert Road, Stanwell Road, Hickman Road, Arcot Street,Glebe Street and Ludlow Lane.The grey area marks the safe space pedestrianised proposal.The town council say the one-way system would enable more chevron parking on Plassey Street, Albert Road and Stanwell Road.Ceri McCann, Rachel Came and Karen Hatton at Andrearsquos Flower Boutique on Glebe Street, think the town will sufferpedestrianisation plans go ahead.: Karen Hatton, Ceri McCann and Rachel Came at Andreas Flower Boutique, Glebe Street" alt"Penarth Times: : Karen Hatton, Ceri McCann and Rachel Came at Andreas Flower Boutique, Glebe Street" class"editor-image": Karen Hatton, Ceri McCann and Rachel Came at Andreas Flower Boutique, Glebe StreetldquoPenarth isnrsquot the type of place you come to and spend a day, itrsquos a place people come and park up and quickly do some shopping, they said. ldquoBusinesses are already feeling the impact of lower footfall due to the social distancing parking trials, and to add this to the mix is poor timing.The plans also include additional bus stops, including one right outside Joan Painesrsquo funeral directors.The new ideas are designed to bring an additional  spaces to the town centre, but this is likely to affect residentsShe says buses stopping outside her shop every half an hour - combined with the one-way system - would be likely to cause too much congestion.ldquoMy main concern is the congestion and the impact that will have on my customers, she said. ldquoIt is not nice to have so much noise, fumes, and congestion outside when yoursquore trying to sort out a funeral.Joan and Tony Paines have made a blown up version of the main town area, so people can better understand the ideas.Ms Paines suggested a bus terminal at Station Approach, and said she thinks a one-way system around the town will also cause heavy traffic on smaller roads such as Railway Terrace, Grove Terrace and Woodland Place.Resident and member of Friendsof the Earth Barry andVale Max Wallis said he is in support of partial pedestrianisation, but questioned the one-way system idea.Mr Wallis said that a one-way system would ldquoworsen traffic and add to town centre pollution, adding: ldquoCovid- will force new thinking. People see the benefits of more walking and cycling. Some shops and businesses will close, with more online shopping. The town centre must become more a meeting and activity place access by bus or bike is more attractive withthe reduced traffic.       ,params: .pushMax WallisStrategic consultant John Jackson, who lives in Penarth, is in favour of partial pedestrianisation of Windsor Road on a trial basis.ldquoThis system works abroad, and works abroad in places where the weather isnrsquot always nice, he said. ldquoI think Penarth needs to be a more attractive environment post lockdown, and that would involve some sort of pedestrianisation.ldquoI think the idea to close off Windsor Road from Lower Glebe Street to the roundabout isnrsquot a bad one, and could instil some confidence for future changes.ldquoWhat I would question is whether the timing is right so soon after businesses have reopened.Five hundred people have responded to the town council survey so far.Cllr Nigel Humphrey - for St Augustines - said: ldquoPeople have been responding to the survey asit is a done deal, when in fact it is intended as part of a constructive dialogue about the future of our town centre."Gideon Calder of Gwyrddio Penarth Greeningsaid: ldquoFrom conversations with people, some are assuming that the current arrangement in the town centre ndash the bollards and one-way system ndash is the same thing as these alternative ideas about creating safer space."In fact these plans are quite dferent. Theyrsquore intended as a solutionto many of the problems which people are identying with things as they are.In a questionnaire circulated to traders by Penarth Business Group which waspassed onto the town council, of the  responders , . per cent said they against partof Windsor Road becoming a traffic free zone. . per cent said they were in favour of a one-way system being introduced to the town centre. . per cent said they were in favour of using wider roads for chevron parking.If you would like to find out more about the proposals visithttps:www.penarthtowncouncil.gov.uk news penarth-post-covid-your-views-on-our-town-centre .If you would like to make your views known but cannot access the survey online, you can call Penarth Town Council on   Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. But the council provided laptops and internet to those in need.Cabinet member for education, Cllr Lis Burnett said: ldquoOur children werenrsquot left without IT connectivity. Museum on Wednesday, September  and the National Wool Museum on Thursday, September .To ensure the visitor experience is as safe and enjoyable as possible, Amgueddfa Cymru has introduced a range of title: republicans slot military funding proposed us coronavirus response package
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Republican measure includes billions for F- fighters, Apache helicopters and infantry carriers sought by Washingtonrsquos powerful defence lobby.Overall, the proposal stuffs  billion dollars into Pentagon weapons systems built by defence contractors like Boeing, Lockheed Martin and General Dynamics.The bill, drafted by Senate Appropriations Committee chairman Richard Shelby, would deposit . billion dollars in Pentagon shipbuilding accounts, boost missile defence systems in Calornia and Alaska and deliver about . billion dollars for C- transport planes and F- fighters manufactured by Lockheed Martin. Some of the F-s could be delivered to an Air National Guard unit in Montgomery, Alabama.Today my colleagues  I introduced the HEALS Act ndash our plan to aid American families  businesses suffering from the #COVID global pandemic. I believe we need to act with a sense of urgency.mdash Richard ShelbyJuly , In several cases, Mr Shelby proposes restoring cuts imposed by the administration that erted almost  billion dollars to help pay for construction of US President Donald Trumprsquos border wall.The Pentagon won signicant defence increases last year with passage of a budget agreement that erased automatic spending cuts known as sequestration.The  billion dollar weapons procurement package is part of a . billion dollar defence portion of the Republicansrsquo  trillion dollar coronavirus response measure, which has been backed by the White House.Providing that money now would help build headroom into the annual defence funding bill that Congress plans to write later this year.The outlook for Mr Shelbyrsquos proposed defence projects could be dim. Democrats slammed the add-ons, and Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said the final package should not stray from the coronavirus response.The inclusion upset Democrats whose votes will be required to pass the bill amid widespread isions among Republicans in the Senate on the measure. They are pressing items such as food aid and funding for postal voting.To Senate Republicans:This is the greatest crisis America has faced in generations, and you are paying attention to your corporate friends.We want a real bill that answers American peoples needs.That deals with the serious problems we face.Thats what were fighting for! pic jCYiexBmdash Chuck SchumerJuly , Democratic senator Debbie Stabenow said: ldquoWe are not going to be supporting anything that does not acknowledge the incredible hardship people are facing on food.ldquoDid you see the states it goes to  Maine. Arizona. Kentucky mdash we have a list, said Senate minority leader Chuck Schumer, naming states where Republicans are defending seats in the November election.The administration never officially asked for the defence funding. It instead delivered informal requests to powerful members of Congress like Mr Shelby who sit at the top of the defence funding , aides say.Senate Republicansrsquo COVID- plan:ndash no food assistancendash no eviction protectionsndash drastic cuts to unemployment benefitsStruggling Americans deserve better.mdash Sen. Debbie StabenowJuly , Even those informal requests left out the  billion dollars for items like planes, ships and missile defence systems, though the White House grew to embrace some of the items.The weapons package grew to include . billion dollars to build Boeing Poseidon surveillance jets, manufactured in Washington and Kansas, with  million dollars more for the companyrsquos Army Apache helicopters, which are made in Mesa, Arizona..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Republicans slot military funding into proposed US coronavirus response package article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a commentOrder byOldest firstNewest firstHighest scoredLowest scoredLoading comments... title: autumn date set opening new south lake leisure centre
story: Tributes flood social media after tragic death of  year old man‘He wore his great big heart openly on his sleeve’ mourners told at funeral of ‘legend’ Gary McConaghyNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleCarsHomes and GardensNewsPeopleAutumn date set for opening of new South Lake Leisure CentreA date has been set for the opening of the new south lake leisure centre in Craigavon with the multi-million-pound facility to open its doors on November .By The NewsroomTuesday, th July , : pmUpdated Tuesday, th July , : pm""The largest capital project to date undertaken by ABC Council, and among the largest in Northern Ireland, the new multi-use sports and leisure complex is described by the council as a major new flagship health and wellbeing destination.Work on the facility was halted by the coronavirus outbreak. Since ing to site Farrans, the contractor in charge of the build, has ensured the contract is completed ready for opening in the Autumn.Farrans has been spearheading the build since initial enabling works got under way early in , creating  jobs on site during construction as part of a project which has delivered at least £. million in direct wages to the local economy.Located at the south side of Craigavon’s balancing lake, the facility is a landmark venue for the area and is situated within a pre-existing network of walking and cycling paths covering around three miles. The council hopes the new leisure centre will welcome visitors from across the borough and beyond to its new -metre pool, a young children’s indoor leisure water feature, a ,m state-of-the-art gym, multiple studios, health and wellbeing suite, sensory room, eight-court sports halls, spin studio, soft play area and an on-site café.It also incorporates an outdoor water sports provision offering a wide range of water based activities including windsurfing, water skiing and paddle sports. The council says the scale of South Lake Leisure Centre has been future-proofed to meet the needs of a growing population and a raising demand from a range of leisure, amateur and professional sporting enthusiasts.Lord Mayor of Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon, Councillor Kevin Savage, sai: “With a confirmed opening date just  weeks away, I am delighted that this stunning new centre - which will have fabulous facilities for everyone in the borough to access and enjoy - is almost complete.“South Lake Leisure Centre provides a once-in-a-generation opportunity to transform and dramatically enhance the quality of health and leisure provision within the borough, providing community access for everyone to the best facilities available in the UK and Ireland.”As part of the preparations for the official opening of South Lake Leisure Centre, interim arrangements have been agreed for leisure facilities in Portadownand Brownlow . Cascades Leisure Complex will be open to the public for lane swimming only in August, remaining open until Saturday th October.Craigavon Leisure Centre will remain open to the public for gym only until Monday th October. Waves Leisure Complex will be closed to the public.When all these facilities, which are approaching the end of their al le close, leisure staff will begin their training at the new South Lake Leisure Centre building.""Most Popular." data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" data-s-el"" title"" class"sc-drMfKT fpqScQ"" alt"" layout"fill"" data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" title"" data-s-el"" class"sc-bGbJRg eOOfIS"Most Popular." data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" data-s-el"" title"" class"sc-drMfKT fpqScQ"" alt"" layout"fill"" data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" title"" data-s-el"" class"sc-bGbJRg eOOfIS"This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us onExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryLocal GuideReader ShopUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter" fill"#ea"©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-gxMtzJ sc-dfVpRl dLpuYr"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyNews you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""""" scale translate " points"  .  .
